Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are exposed to failures due to thermal and redox cycles, above all in the case of unexpected shut downs.
Titulo: SOFC's Anode Protection by Bias Current Application: First Experimental Results on a Short Stack

Sentencas: Effects of thermal cycles related to controlled startup and shutdown can be mitigated by appropriate start/stop strategies, but unpredictable shutdowns strongly damage the devices, especially in anode supported cells.
Titulo: SOFC's Anode Protection by Bias Current Application: First Experimental Results on a Short Stack

Sentencas: On the one hand, the nickel oxidation quickly arises above 250 degrees C at the anode and usually leads to cells cracks; on the other hand, very fast cooling of the SOFC stack down to 250 degrees C could lead to the thermal shock breakage as a consequence.
Titulo: SOFC's Anode Protection by Bias Current Application: First Experimental Results on a Short Stack

Sentencas: Recently, reverse bias current application has been proposed to protect the anode from re-oxidation.
Titulo: SOFC's Anode Protection by Bias Current Application: First Experimental Results on a Short Stack

Sentencas: In the presented work, the reverse bias current approach has been applied on a SOFC stack to assess the technique for relevant power devices.
Titulo: SOFC's Anode Protection by Bias Current Application: First Experimental Results on a Short Stack

Sentencas: The results show that this protection method is promising as a safety approach.
Titulo: SOFC's Anode Protection by Bias Current Application: First Experimental Results on a Short Stack
